Review Title: Excellent breakfast with multiple choice everyday.
Review Text: My stay at the hotel was excellent.I took the executive room. Very spacious, clean, and Quiet An easy access to anywhere and all staff are ready to assist you.All though the bath tub was broken so water was running every. I hope they fix it. The location is perfect for the price. I will sure recommend friends and family for a stay.
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_40', 'Location bubble_50', 'Cleanliness bubble_50', 'Service bubble_50', 'Sleep Quality bubble_50']

Review Text: I recommend for short and extended stays. The staff were very friendly and attentive, especially the restaurant staff. The location is good and the hotel feels very secure. The food quality is good and not too expensive. Rita, the manager is very helpful.
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_40', 'Rooms bubble_40', 'Location bubble_40', 'Cleanliness bubble_30', 'Service bubble_50', 'Sleep Quality bubble_40']

Review Text: The comfort is unmatched. The food was amazing and I had a great experience. Would love to be back but this time, it will be with family. Keep up the great work. Many thanks to the staffs, they were really supportive and ensured I was comfortable
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_50', 'Location bubble_40', 'Cleanliness bubble_50', 'Service bubble_50', 'Sleep Quality bubble_40']

Review Text: Excellent location with good service and great reception from the staff. Breakfast and room service was good. Food prices are a bit high and portions are not as they used to. TV option is excellent with all the major sports channels on the list. Overall an excellent choice.

Review Text: Great experience  Great food Nice location Accessibility  Nice flooring Security on point Liked my view from my room it served the purpose i needed it for  The location is hood amd easily accessible to the places that mattered toe
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_40', 'Location bubble_50', 'Cleanliness bubble_50', 'Service bubble_50', 'Sleep Quality bubble_50']

Review Text: Great location ! Quite central yet has that ‚Äúnicely tucked away‚Äù feel. Staff are pleasant, alert, and helpful. The breakfast is excellent with lots of varieties. My favourite breakfast item is the homemade granola cereal. Will definitely stay here again.
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_50', 'Location bubble_50', 'Cleanliness bubble_50', 'Service bubble_50', 'Sleep Quality bubble_50']

Review Text: This is my go-to hotel for business trips to Lagos.  Solid internet, an extensive breakfast spread, and a small gym with enough equipment to get a workout in.  The location is great if you have many meetings in Victoria Island and Ikoyi.  Overall great value for money.

Review Title: My stay at Park Inn by Radisson.
Review Text: My experience was exception and will love to be back again. I really did enjoy my stay and will recommend a visit to the Radisson to my family and friends from my base. Thank you for the hospitality and welcome.

The hotel is at a good location, with a clean environment and good atmosphere. The room is big and clean. Well equip and the staffs are kind and friendly. The restaurant is üò≤, the breakfast was wonderful. Thank you
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_50', 'Location bubble_40', 'Cleanliness bubble_50', 'Service bubble_40', 'Sleep Quality bubble_50']

Review Text: I was pleased with the location, it was very serene and calming. The reception was top notch, every guest was given an equal treatment. The rooms were top-notch and clean. I appreciated their focus on environmental friendliness. Finally, the meals were real classics.
Specific Ratings: ['Value bubble_50', 'Rooms bubble_50', 'Location bubble_50', 'Cleanliness bubble_40', 'Service bubble_40', 'Sleep Quality bubble_30']

Review Text: Review Text

Review Title: Excellent Service, Food and beautiful rooms
Review Text: I enjoyed every moment of my stay Here. The  hotel is well situated with staff that are attentive professional, friendly and ready to help at all times..I really liked my room, the decor was tasteful, simple and the bed was super comfy....,, Ahhhhh, not forgetting the breakfast - it was always a sumptuous spread with loads of optionsüëçüèæüëçüèæüëçüèæüëçüèæ

General experience was very good. I has a good sleep, enjoyed that ambiance and environment and I liked the food too. The attendants were great, always there to assist and generally approachable. Well done!

Review Title: GREAT CALM HOTEL ON THE BUSINESS VI
Review Text: It's a very calm and decent hotel accommodation great to stay for business. Bar and Restaurant is great sweet delicacies from that kitchen of theirs. I like the facility alot and would recommend it to you. The only down side is the tap water is not clear hence i couldn't make hot coffee with it

The hotel is well located and in a safe environment. We could walk without stress and had most lovely places we wanted to visit close by. The reception staff are wonderful as well as the bar. I found a lovely lady who tried her best to help at the restaurant during the breakfast. I did not really enjoy the breakfast as it did not give choices and as a result of that I did not really eat at the hotel. But I was wonderfully and highly surprised as well as my family when we tried the restaurant's dishes the night before our departure. It was greatly delicious and best value for money. We could rate 10/10 for the food. We got two rooms upgraded and they are wonderful. Through my room had an issue with smell from the bathroom but in all, the rooms and bathrooms are wonderfully neat,

Review Title: Stay at Park Inn by Radisson
Review Text: My family and i enjoyed our 1 day stay at Park Inn. Breakfast was beautiful.  It was buffet. It also had Nigerian alternative. My children really enjoyed the breakfast.Environment was clean and quiet. Check in was seamless.

Review Title: Great Rooms, great location, service is debatable
Review Text: Rooms were great and spacious, location was great - in VI. They were friendly but hounded us for final payment after they told us we can pay the balance at the end of stay. they should just make us pay upfront or take credit card details as a guarantee. It was becoming embarrassing. 2 calls every day wow. We had issues paying as we were from the UK so needed to sort out accounts in Nigeria. We were so happy when we paid because we could finally have peace during our stay.

Good experience. Nice team A good place to stay. Can be recommended to friends are family. Good ambiance, neat facility, good meals. Consistently aiming to improve service and make guests feel at home.

Impressive overall. Need a more friendly check in staff. The guy at the reception was grouchy and unfriendly.  The rooms were clean and functional.  I loved my room. Breakfast selection was impressive for the size of the hotel. Their sea food okro was superb. I ordered it three times from room service. Security staff are wonderful and friendly. A security man named Emeka was exceptional and very observant and welcoming.

Review Title: Excellent hotel service, good room, the shower is excellent with high pressure and very neat bathroom.
Review Text: No regret lodging in this hotel, everything was perfect.  Nice staff, good courtesy. The attention is prompt. All the staff are nice. Ample space for parking is also a good point. The security at gate are good and vigilant.

Right from the moment I stepped it. The staff were exceptionally polite and very kind. They were very helpful and I was very impressed because I have been to lots of hotels in Nigeria and I was shocked at the quality of service I received.
Review Text

Review Title: My Stay at Park Inn by Radisson
Review Text: I enjoyed my stay here at this facility and excellent service was rendered by the staff. The staff here at the hotel were friendly and ready to help. The food was also very nice and service delivery was fast

Review Title: My short stay at Park Inn by Radisson
Review Text: The services were great -  fast internet, excellent room, air condition working perfectly, clean sheets, clean bathroom wares, quite environment, courteous staff, tasty meals, security is top priority, first aid services for emergency. It was a good experience.

I stayed for about 10 days and the general service is not bad however, the restaurant service is especially poor, the staff are rude and off putting and it always seems like they are standing over your shoulder and will willfully ignore you when it serves their agenda (Sulaimon and Oni are especially rude and off putting)  They have a revolving door or rules, dos and don‚Äôt that are inconsistent and impossible to understand, they willfully lie about the availability of certain services. I was very disappointed and never looked forward to the restaurant service, I and the majority of my colleges shared the same view. I‚Äôm sure your experience will be significantly better if you are white cause for some reason, this folks mange to be discriminate against their own kind, Amazing!!!!

Review Title: My Stay at Park Inn By Radisson
Review Text: A nice, sweet and comfortable place to stay. Have been suing here for some time now. A conducive environment. Awesome breakfast. This is highly recommended. You will not regret your stay. Really nice food options at breakfast.

Review Title: Really Good and a highly recommend
Review Text: Right at the heart of VI, the hotel is on a quiet street. Staff were very professional, room was excellent and has all the amenities you will expect in a Radisson hotel. Bathroom was clean except some signs of damp over the shower.  Breakfast is affordable but more variety will be good.   Overall, I will return to this hotel

Located in a safe vicinity and rooms are nicely renovated. Only negative feedback is noise can be heard from adjoining joint room. Staff are friendly and helpful. Limited English TV channels. Felt safe throughout the stay.

The stay was very pleasant. The staff were very pleasant and the service was excellent. The door in my room was however a it rickety but this did not diminish the experience. Room service was great but the rooms could do with extra water bottles.

good hotel, clean, service excellent, sfaff very attentive, no complaint except tv channel selection not very good. nothing more to say, why do i have to wirite 200 charactors to say a hotel is good and nice to stay at

I had a terrible 1 day at this hotel.  First check in was over 45minute.  Then I was sent a room that was big for nothing. The ACs didn't work and when I complained, it was fixed only for me to wake up sweating in the middle of the night . The curtains were old and dirty

Excellent stay at this hotel, staff very helpful & the hotel was very clean. Breakfast was exceptional with lots of varieties. And the room service was great. Will definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again in future.
Review Text

The hotel is in a very good location, it is very clean and has the most respectful, professional and friendly staff. Everyone here from the GM, Rita, to the guys at the check-in counter and the restaurant staff are always willing to help you ensure you have an amazing time at the hotel. The hotel has become my first choice when i need to stay in VI, either for work or pleasure.

The hotel was well maintained and clean. The staff were efficient and friendly. The room was clean and well appointed. The bed was soft and the pillows perfect. The bathroom was modern and clean. The lighting was good as well and the room amenities adequate.

We arrived on the 24th of December. a day prior we got a call to reconfirm our bookings. This was done swiftly and I was impressed. When my family and I arrived, looking forward to our Christmas relaxation and vacation on the Island, we did a reception check-in. We were also hungry and opted to have lunch while awaiting check-in. While service was courteous the check-in we got a bit anxious with the wait time. Nevertheless, we had lunch and eventually got checked into two rooms as pre-booked.  Overall service was excellent. From the security guards to the cleaners, it appeared all were well trained in customer service. The food on offer was so delicious we sent words of appreciation to the chef. The traditional cuisine were my favorites. My kids had foreign food, burgers

Review Title: MY RECENT STAY AT THE PARKINN BY RADISSON VI LAGOS
Review Text: The recent upgrading of the hotel rooms and facilities was top notch and provided a more refreshing stay in the facility. Of particular interest is the inclusion of in-room full kitchenette facilities which brought the hotel rooms in line with any international standard.

Had a very nice time at Park Inn by Radisson Serviced Appartments. They render excellent services, have very comfortable rooms, diligent and courteous workers. I'll definitely be back some other time.

I have always had positive experiences at Park Inn by Radisson.  These which inform the reason why I always return to the hotel whenever I am in Lagos.  The hotel personnel are at the same time, professional, helpful and welcoming.

Review Title: Great hotel with excellent customer service and hygiene concept
Review Text: From London to New York, Lagos, Berlin, Hamburg, Abeokuta, Dusseldorf, and Sao Paulo, this is the best Radisson brand hotel I have ever stayed in. The Covid-19 hygiene concept is excellent. The rooms and common areas are exceptionally clean, and cleanliness is maintain every hour of the day. It takes a lot of commitment to do this.  Check-in was excellent because the staff were very patient with my children and they let us have the suite we wanted. The bar staff and the kitchen staff members were exceptional; they were attentive and were great with children. The swimming pool is well-maintained and my kids love it so much!   Our suite was big for a family of four, and it was very clean. The cleaning staff did a great job, and so were the security staff members who were very

Nice staff, great service and good atmosphere! I would stay again!!! Rooms are in great shape. Even though location busy it is located in a place to get around to eat and be entertained!!!! A+ Holes for all

Very Disappointed. The hotel doesn't have the proper credit card machine for foreign credit cards unless local debit card, which means foreign credit card are not accepted but they will not tell you that. Bad business practice!!!

Review Title: My review of Park Inn by Radisson
Review Text: I decided to take a day off just to rest and reboot and I chose Park Inn by Radisson to do just that. Their staff were amazing. The environment is lovely. It has a pool open to all guests. The room and bathroom was so very clean and well taken care off. I was impressed. I had dinner and breakfast from the restauranf via room service and gosh! Food was sooo very lovely. I'm a foodie. I must say I had a lovely time. Will definitely be a regular! Thanks guys.
Review Text

I had a very comfortable stay with excellent service. Hope to be back. And, I‚Äôm going to definitely recommend that my colleagues patronize Park Inn by Radisson. I do hope the management keep up the standards.

perfect place for Business or leisure in VI and environs. standard rooms, good shower and the food and snacks are just cute. friendly and respectful staff looking forward to visit some time again some time soon

Good Hotel. Great Staff. Love the Bed and the bathroom. Really enjoyed Breakfast and very friendly staff all around. But need more parking space for cars. Great Pool and the ambience was really nice had this homely feeling about it

The staff are very professional and polite.breakfast was awesome . My room was also very clean and the hotel is beautiful .Very serene environment too . All in all, I ll recommend this place to more pple like I have always done !

I had a wonderful time in the hotel. I was quite pleased at the protocols implemented to curb the risk of COVID. Their breakfast buffet was extensive and had so many options. The in house bar had great drinks at affordable prices. Overall pleased üòÄ

Centrally located and quiet place to get some rest. Friendly staff, clean facilities, fast service and really spacious rooms. This is my second stay at this property and it definitely won't be my last.

The hotel is good and staff very courteous. The ambiance is good as well. The food is good. Staff are willingly to provide assistance when needed. A good place to be with family and friends and for business meetings as well.

Pretty good experience and amazing stay with good customer care and good food also. But the pool wasn't in use which is quite discouraging but overall the experience was good, no complaint at all thanks

The room furniture and entire  hotel management  are okay. I will recommend the hotel to my colleagues in Lagos for business trip. Please,send a scanned copy of Hotel furniture and room settings  to me for advert..

This hotel was adequate, although much better than expected. There seemed to be a lot of maintenance needed in my first room, nearly everything was substandard ‚Äì but they resolved it very quickly and put me in a new room without questions. Pleased with the service.   I didn't sleep too well ‚Äì I suspect it's because there is poor ventilation in the room I stayed in.
Review Text

The newly refurbished hotel is a welcome change. Park in Radisson offers excellent value for money. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The only drawback for me was that the hot water was not working in the morning.

Nice, quiet place to stay. Their breakfast is the best with a wide variety to chose from. The croissants especially. Meals are good & room service is excellent. Nice spaces to sit and relax. Spacious and clean rooms. The place is quiet and with privacy. Gym and pool on site.

I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. It was worth it and I will definitely be coming back. Perhaps consider a ramp for luggages in the second building or even wheelchair access, even though I had help, taking luggage in and out could have been easier.

I and my parent had a lovely stay in the Park Inn. The service received was excellent. Staff were extremely helpful (especially the  Omotola (receptionist) , John, Gerald, Suleiman and Oni) and are a credit to the hotel. They ensured we had a pleasant and safe stay. The food was absolutely superb though the portions were huge. I hope Radisson will continue to invest in the hotel (some pieces of furniture could be upgraded) and I look forward to staying there again.

Nice place, looks like a home from the outside but good on the inside! Generally friendly n professional staff! Mr Endurance and Mr Aniekan , keep up the good work. There is room for improvements thoughüôèüëå

Excellent staff and service most people l know by names, l have already planned my forthcoming stay ,l have also recommended to my colleagues and business ,l am also looking forward to see the finished upgrades, also once you meet Rita,Peter the Chef and restaurant staff especially Suleiman,Rufus and Moses from Laundry

It was a nice experience at the hotel and there is lot scope for improvement especially in the area of rooms example (tv, ac, lighting, fragnance, furniture, toiletries, etc). Food and exterior is good.

First and last time, old hotel, with old furnatures and old noisy AC. It is in the middle of a street pazar or something, location is not good. No need to waste your time and money here, i think Radisson Blu would be a much better option

Nice place to chill especially if you have a number of actives within the busy city of Lagos. Access from anywhere in Victory Island. Enjoyed the hospitality and stay, the main pool was under reconstruction though, and breakfast was great. The gym is small sized with a series of things to do.

Good breakfast. Nice bed but the hotel was still then Protea. It will definitely make do with some overhauling. Great staffs...and ever smiling manager who takes time to say hi with her beautiful smile.
Review Text

Beautiful and clean serene. The food is awesome.  One of the best I have had in hotels.    The hospitality is top notch and the staff are dedicated to their job and very friendly.  I enjoyed my stay.I am planning to go againüòä

The rooms are well laid out and are quiet and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast menu offers a good variety, and the dinner is well prepared with a good selection. My meals were all excellently prepared and was exceptional. The pool outside is relaxing after a days work. Overall good value for money, definitely will visit again when I return to Nigeria.

Good hotel with friendly staff. Food is good though I couldn't get Indian food as menue is restricted to continental or local. But they prepare good and keep on taking feedback. Rooms are good. Only grudge is that Gym is not properly equipped

Upon arrival at the hotel, I was told the type of room I booked wasn't available even though I completed the booking online. Parking was also a challenge, so I initially had to park outside the hotel premises.

Review Title: A Good Place for Relaxation and Work
Review Text: I have always seen this hotel as "home away from home" simply because of the tranquility in the hotel, the facilities available and the good food.  Staff members are very friendly and the hotel is generally clean and peaceful.

Review Title: Comment on Stay on Park Inn by Radisson Serviced Apartments V. I.
Review Text: The room facilities need urgent upgrade. The toilet on the first room signed to me (main block) did not flush. The public places in the rugs, chairs, etc., in the annex where I was relocated are old, collapsed, and worn out, and the alternative room assigned to me ther had a stale odour, because the windows are permanently sealed with no opportunity for natural ventilation. The hot-water shower in one of the two newly-renovated rooms (again assigned to me in the main block did not work. The wall by th head of the head of the bed dripped water, and the room had odour. It was difficult to achieve optimal regulation of the air-conditioning. The TV has very only one international and one local news channel; this is too poor.

Very nice and clear hotel.  Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed and they were honest about the problem with our room booking.  We were upgraded to a suite without incurring extra charges.  The  hotel is clean and provides us with great hospitality.   I can‚Äôt fault any of the staff but special thank you to Rita(Manager). who was very accommodating to our needs and made us feel welcome and valued.  Rooms were cleaned daily.

Review Title: Review of Park Inn by Radisson 4/07/2019
Review Text: Great hotel, good services, lovely and professional personnel. I enjoyed my second stay and I look forward to another wonderful experience of great hospitality. I came on a work training and also used the conference facility as well as the bar and pool side relaxation areas.

Excellent service delivery, adequate security, friendly, smart and dedicated staff, serene environment, nice, tasty and good breakfast, clean and neat toilet tools and facilities, good location. Excellent service delivery

Staffs are very friendly and exceptionally professional. I enjoyed my night at the hotel. The room was large, though the bathroom was a little bit small but it was okay. The restaurant was OK. Overall, it was a good experience. I will definitely come back.
Review Text

Thw facilities are awesome and the serenity was great. The room facilities are fantastic and highly roomy.  Car park was not good enough, it needs urgent improvement. The experience was generally pleasant.

After a very long journey from Benin City to Lagos and the Park inn we were greeted by friendly reception staff. As I had contacted the hotel prior our arrival Rita the general manager greeted us. As we had to go road instead of air we were given a complementary drink and upgraded to a deluxe suite. What a great gesture thank you;o)  The suite was perfect. Once settled in we ordered room service, which was promptly delivered. Breakfast wide range of choice. Selection of traditional Nigerian dishes and continental. Served with the best tasting coffee!!! Evening menu again selection of traditional Nigerian and continental dishes, which all tasted amazing. If it was Egusi Soup with Yam or a burger........ Rooms, grounds, all in perfect condition. I would like to thank Rita,

Review Title: Nice ambience and friendly staff . Food was great and hotel felt very safe and secure . Overall great experience .
Review Text: Nice hotel . Clean and friendly staff . Nice complimentary breakfast . Great room service . Hotel is near a lot of restaurants . Place felt very secure and safe . Only slight improvement needed to restroom /bathroom for maintenance and cleanliness . Overall very pleasant stay . Staff were very pleasant and accommodating . Will definitely book again .

Great service, very friendly staff, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Going through an upgrade at the moment, but did not interfere with my stay. Just needs the finishing touches. Will stay there again next time.

Over all, I would say it memorable. Staff I encountered were honestly down to earth, friendly and willing to be of assistance. There was only a limitation of food options during all the meals..........more of Nigerian options is advised.

there was no switch above the headboard.  So being lying I could not turn off the light.  the lamp above the tv did not go off despite the fact that I reported to the reception.  Frequent power cuts that did not last long but rather unpleasant.

Uthe hotel is under renovation .rooms have been and are being upgraded.  It's cosy and friendly.  The food was very good as we had dinner there. Nice breakfast too. Convenient location  for us as very close by.

A good and convenient location for our hospital appointment. Breakfast arrangement could be more flexible and less costly. Housekeeping needs to be more detailed. Curtains and windows should be dust free to prevent dust allergens. Pleasant enough staff. Lack of follow through on requests.

Review Title: Service well beyond expectations! Good food and ambiance....
Review Text: At check-in it was found that there was an issue with the online booking but the Operations Manager (Rita) and the Reservations department (Endurance) went out of their way to address the issues.  The rooms are very comfortable with excellent bathrooms (walk in shower) and a standalone desk to work at.   We very much enjoyed the food, in addition to the service. The team goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and it is therefore that we can highly recommend the Park Inn VI.  Since we were on a long stay, we have taken the time to look around and compare rates vs. quality cleanliness and general ambiance. Of course, we have not seen every hotel in VI but we rated Park Inn highest without a doubt.  The following is highly subjective but could be of interest to some: the

Arriving for family funeral with all the stress and emotions that accompany such trip, we were welcomed Very warmly even when the staff did not know why we came. To me,that says it all. Throughout our stay, any tiny issue was resolved within minutes, not hours. The staff were very friendly and professional at the same time, that makes it so good. The atmosphere of the hotel was warm, the breakfast and the evening meals we enjoyed was good. Any problem was resolved by staff and their Manger Rita, I would recommend her highly for her competency and professionalism which transcends to her staff. I shall be recommending this hotel to family and friends .
Review Text

Great room for leisure and business with a nice swimming pool and a free complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning to kick off the day. The warm friendly staff are at your beck and call for movement advise if you are new to Lagos. The only disadvantage is the limited parking space.

great hotel with options of pools and restaurant , welcoming  and friendly staff one of the most flexible hotel I have visited in terms of customers choice and personalized service and simply but nice decoration a total definition of simplicity . my personal and most of my friends view the best place to have jumbo prawns in Lagos .

The feel of the luxurious Protea Hotel. Friendly staff. The facility could do with some upgrades in interior decoration to measure up with the ever changing trend in hospitality industry. The bed is very comfortable.

Spent a few nights here and loved the simplicity of the room and the prompt service. Two pools and their BBQ'S are great. My favourite was the club sandwich and the deconstructed salmon salad.  When the wifi works it's great but can be a pain when it goes off. The power went off a few times but general the genset kicked in swiftly.

Great Hotel, rooms modern and clean, with good views of the water. Great location. Great food and restaurants - on water. Service outstanding and food good. Has all facilities Gym, Spa - although seems to be construction work going on in gym area. Only complaint would be the bathroom in the room - lacks extraction fan - so would be weary of mold if not aired properly

I often have to travel for work and I usually stay in the Protea in VI. The staff is simply amazing. Very attentive, they always greet me warmly and go above and beyond their call of duty. Rita, the manager is also exceptional. She always greets me with a warm hug and checks in to make sure my stay is going well. I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. I would highly recommend it.   Anuli

Great service and hospitality, friendly staff, and a bit of South Africa in the big city of Lagos.  The hotel is intimate and cozy. The food is great - whether its breakfast or dinner. There is Nigerian for those  who are daring (or local) and South African favorites for those that are longing for home. Quality great. Rooms and facilities not flashy but more than adequate! Lekker!

The Protea Hotel Victoria Island has a lot of amazing attributes to it - contemporary, comfortable, clean and a phenomenal staff. I stayed in the hotel for almost two weeks. I must say, my stay was quite pleasant, and the staff was second to none. The hotel staff are polite and exude the real Nigerian warmth and friendliness. Check in went fast with friendly staff that assisted me to my room. Everyone that worked in the hotel from the desk staff to the GM is inviting and very helpful. The rooms are modern, clean, and the hotel was always in excellent condition.   Situated in the heart of Victoria Island Protea Hotel is a suitable place to go out from and get back to quickly.  Location is safe and gives you easy access around Lagos. The hotel is within walking distance of

Excellent room service, staff are very friendly too. Rates are very reasonable for a hotel in Victoria Island. The building may be a bit old fashioned but overall basic amenities are available  and functional. This is a great choice anytime.

Review Title: Nice but need a serious refresh
Review Text: Protea has a lot of good points and on top of them is probably the staff. Everyone here from the front office to the GM is nice and very helpful, the restaurant is ok too, food is good and well cooked, breakfast is coming with a large choose of pretty good food.  However the place need a complete renovation. Apparently this is scheduled for this year so let‚Äôs be patient
Review Text

A comfortable bed, a *very nice* pepper soup for dinner, and consistently excellent service from the staff at every level. The rooms are a bit bland and the hall isn't air conditioned, and the view isn't much, so this is not a super fancy hotel, but it is a genuinely comfortable and welcoming one, with everything clean and easy. I'm not entirely easy to please, and my first impression is quite positive.

I have been doing business in Nigeria for many years and have stayed at this Protea at least 10 times since 2005.   The rooms are modern and clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. The prices are reasonable (consider a protea Card if you go often for further discounts)   It is well placed on Victoria Island. They have backup power for the regular power cuts. Internet speed is ok. There is a gym and quite a useful business centre.  The breakfasts consist of a selection of fruits, yoghurts, pastries and then some hot foods. There is a chef who will make you an omelette etc. It‚Äôs a decent breakfast.   Overall it‚Äôs a good value hotel, well situated, with modern rooms and very good service.

Overall very happy with the service and quality of stay.  Check in went fast with very friendly staff that assisted me to my room. Curtain in room peels off as it uses sticky strip to hang.. Not good. Room linen was clean and fresh. Shower had difficulties as it changes between extreme cold and hot.. Struggled to just get the balance. Breakfast was good. Variety not so great but enough to fill you. Room Service was great with delicious servings except for the lamb chops that was awful. Restaurant menu and room service menu are the same thus can enjoy full service in my room. Check out was quick and efficient.  Keep up the good work.

I have stayed at this spot over the years and met the same attention to customer service and attention to detail as always. The hotel is a 55 room hotel with all the facilities you need on a trip to lagos. Situated in the heart of Victoria Island it's a great place to go out from and get back to quickly. The staff are very helpful and go out of their way to ensure you have a good experience. Rooms are comfortable, clean and showers are strong. Altogether a nice experience as always, I seem to think they are getting even better and standing out which is tough in a place like lagos that is packed with Hotels. Breakfast buffet was simple and nice not too elaborate but very functional. No down points at all. Suleiman at the restaurant was  very helpful, my compliments to him. Look

Review Title: Old Glory - needs a face lift of the rooms
Review Text: I changed rooms and each of the rooms had serious issues of aging and dilapidated furniture and flooring.  My impression is that the hotel management is sucking out all the revenue they can extract from the establishment and will probably abandon ship at the end of the lease which could be imminent.  Else, how could i understand the total lack of reinvestment into maintenance and upgrade of the facility.  it is a disgrace to the name and standard of Protea Hotels.  Everything was problematic....from the desk chairs that were crooked in both rooms, the veneer on the furniture was peeling off as are the ones on the floor.  the bath towels are old and faded; the shower door does not close snugly; so, water splashes into the bathroom space. the hand towel hook on the wall is broken

I stayed at the facility in April.  I was there for the funeral of a family friend.  The staff of the hotel was extremely accommodating and kind.  They were very professional in their delivery.  Additionally, the food served at breakfast was extremely good and of incredible quality.  Their chef knows his onions.

Very comfortable, good security. The rooms were well appointed, water worked and hot water dependable! The restaurant's food was good and service friendly and helpful. In a quiet area for Lagos. I would stay there again.

Nice hotel for the price, but not as close to the airport as I expected and kind of hard to find.. The restaurant was nice and the room was very cozy.I would stay there again, especially for an overnight layover.

Always a pleasure staying here. The staff welcoming. The manager a star. The chef superb.  A home from home. A typical old style Protea hotel and How a hotel should be run.   The wifi now fixed and superb.

For a hotel in the middle of V.I. it really has a feel of tranquility witch can be a real blessing when you get back from the office. Swimming pool areas are perfect for a relaxing evening. Best breakfast in Lagos and apparently a secret spot for good Burgers! The rooms are neat, clean and spacious. Everything up to standard with very professional and attentive staff. Keep it up!
Review Text

Review Title: Great, friendly hotel with best hamburgers in Lagos
Review Text: Best hamburgers in town! The prawns is another favourite as well as the T-bone steak. Good, comfortable accommodation with functional rooms and great, large showers and good water pressure. Staff were very friendly with the breakfast chef remembering my egg order the next day.

Review Title: Great, affordable find on VI for business
Review Text: Just back from a 9-night stay here. Was impressed at the location, room was big, internet was very very fast for Nigeria, bed was very very comfy and shower was great too.  Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful - very accommodating and even let me check out a little later as well, as my flight wasn't until much later on.  Breakfast was a bit basic- nothing to write home about, but the omelettes were exceptional and again, the waiting staff were lovely  Only thing I would say is that the rooms weren't made up that well - on a couple of occasions the old towels were taken but not replaced. But they did send up towels immediately when I asked for them, so that's fine  A good, cost-conscious stay in a good, solid location

Review Title: Nice Secure Hotel But Could Do Better
Review Text: Stayed at this hotel for a week on business and felt very secure whilst staying as well as enjoying the very comfortable room. Hotel is quiet and staff tend to leave you alone which is nice. Rate was fairly good (‚Ç¨140 per night) so it reasonably priced.  Bed is very comfortable with nice fittings within the room. Bathroom has a great shower and separate bath which was much appreciated. Wireless was good and fairly quick.  A few areas it could improve on is with the choice of food and how expensive it is to get food within the hotel. Breakfast is about ‚Ç¨18 and a simple burger is about ‚Ç¨25. As per the previous review, choice is fairly limited for dinner with burgers and steak covering most of the menu. Some other dishes would give people staying long term something to interest

Booked into this hotel by my local Agent and staying here for 18 days. Have found the hotel very good, staff more than helpful and always with a smile. Room and services are good. Internet access is excellent as is the selection of TV channels. For a long stay I find the menu selection quite limited, but all selecting I have had were good. Breakfast buffet is excellent and always open on time at 06:30 each morning. Perfect for business time requirements. I use the fitness centre each day, its small but well equiped. Only very slight complaint is the laundry facility which struggles to meet the promised and listed return delivery time. In one instance my laundry was not returned until the next day. Would I stay here again - Yes I would.

Review Title: Near one of the biggest hotels in Nigeria but holding it's own!
Review Text: Where to start? Champagne welcome, great food, clean rooms. Friendly staff, clean pools, great proximity to everything. This hotel is my favourite on the Island now! Only thing that sucked was the gym, too tiny and rusty.

I stay here quite often. The staff are very friendly and helpful in the bar and dining hall. Breakfast is great and dinner is first class. The food quality is always great. We'll done to the Protea VI team. See you in a few weeks.

Feels more like an upgraded dormitory than a hotel. They can do a lot better with ventilation for the rooms. The rooms smell stale, like a mix of cigarette, smoke, and sweat. The toilet bowl was stained and the towels quality was quite poor.  It can also be a bit noisy, maybe cos of the way the hotel is designed. the front desk staff have an attitude. No cheerful check in's or checkout. and this is consistent for the times i have stayed with them. At the restaurant, i asked for bread my bread to be warmed, the server took it to the microwave, and warmed it openly. i was distraught, and so i asked him to please discard it and  cover another one  to warm it, the guy took a cling film wrap, put it over the bread,and warmed it. increasing the BPA content and exposing me to a higher

I keep coming back here, never quite sure why, I guess at least the staff are friendly and helpful.  The price is Ok and location good. Rooms need renovation, menu needs working on, breakfast is sort of OK. It's fine for few days, of and the internet is often terrible. Will probably stay again though.

Stayed in the hotel for two nights, its at the heart of Victoria Island. I enjoyed the service and the caring attitude of the staff, I must say the breakfast is top notch, and I won't forget to mention the clean room and very fast WiFi. Would recommend this place for its great value if you have business on the Island.

This Protea property is located on Victoria Island. It is owned by the African hotel chain and unlike other Protea properties in the African continent is not owned  or managed by Marriott - at least not as of the date of my stay in 2016, FEB.  You would be advised to ensure the hotel will accept your credit card prior to arrival if that is how you plan to settle your account. This had been arranged for me in advance and the hotel happily accepted my credit card.  The hotel has very good security and because it is a local hotel is more low key than some of the bigger American chains which I would avoid. It is a nice hotel and has air conditioning and modern facilities in the rooms. There is a full service restaurant and swimming pool. Across the street a block of so from the
Review Text

Visited Nigeria on a two week visit.  On this occasion and all future I will always use this hotel, as long as the staff doesn't change.  Old story the staff makes a hotel feel like home! Thank you Tim and staff.   Dinner, lunch and breakfast super! Thank you chef Shane.   Airport transport arranged, local transport arranged, laundry beautifully done, and an overall wonderful experience.  Only downside is the free Wifi doesn't work on my VPN but I was promised it will be corrected.

Review Title: My first choice when staying in Lagos.
Review Text: Been staying here for going on 4 years since I first started doing business in Nigeria.  A good hotel, well run, great staff, clean, two pools and a small but well equipped gym and the food is good with a varied international and local menu.  Ideal position to get around Ikoyi, Victoria Island and over to Lekki.  Always recommend it to anyone who travels to this interesting city.

I have stayed at this hotel several time and each time the staff from restaurant staff to manages always remembers me and can tell me when I was last visiting. The service throughout is excellent. The food is out of this world and I always feel like I am coming home when I stay there.

Review Title: A little worn at the edges
Review Text: This Protea is in a good location on VI right opposite the massive Eko Hotel once Lagos's most prestigious hotel.  The rooms are good but showing a little wear and tear at the edges.  Not quite up to Protea Standards and actually not part of the aquisition of Protea by Marriot so I think things are on hold until the future of this hotel and a few other smaller Protea hotels in Nigeria is

This is not my first trip to Nigeria, neither my first stay at the Hotel. I have stayed an various hotels in the area, but this one is the best choice as a home away from home. Tim (GM), Shane (Chef) and all the staff, to many to mention, receives me with open arms no matter what time I arrive.  4:00am or midnight, they are always friendly and helpful as you are part of their family.  Every time I arrive Tim would greet me by name.   I was quite surprised with my visit that the menu actually had a dish on which I requested with my previous visit.  I have tried it and was first class.  Now that is service and where the recommendations of the guest are taken seriously.  The staff listen, assist in any way possible and is always friendly.  There is not a single staff member that

The staff are friendly and helpful. The manager, Tim, was always close by and made you feel welcomed. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The wifi can get a bit strained at peak hours. The breakfasts were good and well executed. The gym is small but has the essentials for when you need to relieve the work related stresses of Nigeria. As a business traveler the hotel catered well for my needs. The hotel could, however, become a bit confined if you are on a long business stay and you you don't have the opportunity of getting out for dinners in the evenings.

Review Title: Not impressed. Basic and bare minimum.
Review Text: Rooms are big, but old and dirty. Food and drinks are crazy expensive for what you get. Service is crap. I will not stay here again. There are way better hotels for the price they are charging that have much better facilities.

I have stayed here several times and its always been good. booking with Lanre is always pleasant and check in is seamless. Rooms are large, well maintained and clean. Good food and really friendly staff round out the offering. Good wifi and a desk to allow easy working in the room

Reception was efficient and the complimentary voucher for a draft beer topped the bill. We stayed only the one night but found the rooms comfortable and clean. Oh and the in room air conditioners work up a storm. 16 degrees all night long, beautiful. Dinner of peri peri spatchcock chicken was hot and super tender. The breakfast was efficient and the grill worked well. Big fluffy omelettes and a nice selection of fruit. I never believe in a 10/10 rating but this hotel came close.

Review Title: Comfortable hotel, great food, good location
Review Text: Protea hotel Victoria Island is a nice boutique hotel in the bustling VI area of Lagos. The rooms are nicely furnished, beds comfortable and bathrooms are modern.   The food is delicious. I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and as such I have eaten a number of meals from their menu and I must say that the food is consistently of very good quality and taste. My favourites are the signature grilled prawns (which in my opinion are the best in Lagos) and the prawn cocktail.   Location is safe and gives you easy access around Lagos. If you occasionally decide to go on a night out or dine out, you couldn't ask for a better location. There are many options to choose from in the area.   The hotel offers free wifi and also has a business centre, where you can use their computer
Review Text

Exactly what you would expect from the Protea Group. Clean and neat room with basic amenities. Very Helpful Staff. Good location in Victoria Island. Great Breakfast well suited to our South African taste.

Review Title: Centrally located - easy access to different areas of Lagos
Review Text: Most important thing for me was location and being able to get around Lagos without spending a lot of time stuck in traffic.  Rooms comfortable enough, but traffic could be noisy in rooms which faced the main road on the lower floors. Air conditioning worked well.  Breakfast included a good variety which was delicious. Also enjoyed the other meals there.    Enjoyed my stay.

Nice hotel to stay for business. Friendly staff, very good seafood and good breakfast. Please don't fault to order their Jumbo Prawns with steamed vegetables. Very reliable wifi in rooms and lobby/restaurant. Fair room rates and walking distance to Total deep water building located at Eko towers.

The staff are second to none in terms of helpfulness and proactive. The room was fine. There is a good casual sitting area for meeting people. Food is very good (breakfast, dinner). However they failed to make my 3.30 am wake up call for the plane - luckily my phone alarm worked!

Review Title: Protea Hotel, Lagos, Victoria Island, Nigeria
Review Text: I was a guest at the Protea Hotel, Victoria Island, for 4 weeks while on business.  The hotel is fairly small, (around 60 rooms???), but is huge on customer service!  The General Manager, TIm, and the Executive Chef, Morne, set the example for the hotel staff and were visible from early morning breakfasts through the day until late evening. All staff members greeted the guests with genuine pleasure, not just plastic smiles.  Morne made an 'out of this world' ox-tail on two sepaprate occasions and out-did himself and his kitchen both times.The prawns are the largest I've ever seen, but be cautious of the 'peri peri' option...Unless you can do handstands in the shower. :-)) My room had an easterly view and being on the 4th floor meant that I got extra (personal) training by using

We stayed at another hotel on Victoria Island which was shocking. Someone recommended Protea Hotel. I went to check it out and decided to move my whole team there. The rooms are awesome, but the showers are world class. I have to say that the executive chef Morne really knows his way around the kitchen and the fact that all his meat is imported, makes a massive difference. Get ready to have the best burges, fillets, fresh seafood, etc you will ever have in Nigeria. The GM Tim really knows what his guests wants and goes out of his way to make sure that all their needs are taken care of. I will be going back to Lagos in 3 weeks time and there is only one place I will be staying at and that is the Protea Hotel on VI, Lagos Nigeria.

Basic business hotel but serves the purpose and better service than some of the others we have stayed at. Good value for money and decent breakfast. Has the usual power problems faced by Lagos but they seem to cope extremely well. Good location to handle Lagos traffic as well

Review Title: Great business hotel with all the necessities
Review Text: I have not stayed at this hotel in 5 years,  and kudos to the management team of this hotel , they are doing a fantastic job of running this place, its a comfortable, efficient , friendly and a  clean place to call home while on business.  Sure there are much more fancier hotels abound , but if you consider the price, it is unbeatable.

Protea are a hotel brand with branches in Lagos state and across Africa. I stayed here for one night a few months back while attending an event in Victoria island. The location is spot on for clubbing, night life, events, meetings and attractions In the Victoria island/ Ikoyi area.  Service here is not only international but exceptional. You are catered for right to the very tee, and staff always give you that bit extra.   I arrived to find a spacious, well lit room with high quality bedding. It did not have that smell that most hotels in Lagos have when they have been vacant for a while (a damp musty odor). I received a complimentary kit which included your usual essentials plus bottled water and bathrobe.   After placing my order for breakfast the chef double checked how I

Good ambience for a meeting. Coffee breaks by the pool, fantastic.   Especially when you get the feel of waves by the beach, very soothing to a hardworked brain.  Evening dinner, superb with a pianist serenading my meals. You wanna know more, spend a night there.
Review Text

I arrived around 11pm at the hotel and was exhausted, but after being greeted by all the friendly smiles, seeing my very spacious, comfortable room with an enormous shower and a great dinner I not only felt at home, I felt revived. I came here for business and the hotel has unlimited internet access, conference facilities with catering, a business centre and taxis on the premises. ALL the staff are extremely helpful and friendly, it is more than a job for them - they truly WANT to serve you and went out of their way to ensure that I do NOT get any spicy or oily food. This hotel has happy, competent staff delivering great quality and service with a smile. On my second day, after a peaceful sleep (no noise), I found out that both the General Manager and Executive Chef of the hotel

I've stayed at Protea Hotel VI a couple of times. Absolutely great little hotel and feels homey. The staff is great, it's not far from anything and there's always someone ready to help.   I've stayed at a few hotels in Victoria Island and in must say, this is one of the top 2 and this one is number 1 purely because it it's great value for money as well.   Well done guys. Keep it up.

I have stayed at the Protea VI many times over the years and it's a great option for a business hotel in Victoria Island. It half as expensive as the top hotels in the area and it is almost as good. The service levels are now excellent, check-ins are quick and easy, waiters are friendly. The rooms have been refurbished and are very comfortable. Huge showers with good water pressure. The only negative is the Wi-Fi which is somewhere between patchy and non-existent. It seems to go down when the power goes off which is every half an hour or so and it's very slow when it's working, especially in the higher up rooms. This should be an easy fix, guys.

From the moment I entered the property to the last second spent in the property it was exceptional. the staff from the top to the bottom levels was friendly and helpful. Special mention was deserved by Tim Webster the GM of the Hotel and His Head chef Morne Karelse. The rooms were also well laid out and in good condition.  I will definitely visit the Hotel again and hope that the local South African hotels follows in Protea Hotel Victoria Island footsteps

From the moment walking into this Hotel and being greeted with warm friendly smiles, the 5 days spent at this hotel was an absolute pleasure. It is small hotel and all the staff are very helpful and incredibly friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The food is top quality and the chef ensures fresh food to top international standards. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable and the bathrooms are clearly upgraded with great showers. From the warmth of the South African Hotel Manager, to the smiles of all the staff every moment spent in this hotel was extraordinary and felt right at home.

First time I stayed at this Protea, I was taken in by the serenity, and aesthetic functional beauty of the hotel. Every little detail is thought through especially the placement of airconditioners in the rooms .  This was in 2008.  2015 and it is still as well maintained as it was then.  The staff are polite and exude the real Nigerian warmth and friendliness.  Yet professional.   The food is wonderful; local or international.  It was great to see Chigozie again.  This is home

Review Title: Stylish, comfortable gem in Vitoria Island, Lagos
Review Text: I didn't book this hotel, but I'm glad I stayed here. This stylish hotel augments it's image with 5 star excellent service. My room was clean and tastefully furnished and it's always a bonus to find complementary tea and coffee on hand, plus an efficient room service staff on hand 24/7. This boutique hotel, clearly prides itself on attention to detail and excellent staff. It's nice to see fresh flowers in the lobby' very good food and a welcoming smile from the staff who displaying a natural can do attitude.

Had the pleasure of staying at the Protea Victoria Island for a short one night, wish it had been more!  Don't be deterred by the lackluster exterior or entrance, the inside will truly delight you.  Contemporary, comfortable, clean and a phenomenal staff.  Rita (the property manager) greeted us with a warmth we hadn't seen in the previous 6 days of Abuja and Lagos.  Sitting us down with complementary cappuccinos and an easy check in. Tidy little gym, 2 pools, great bar and well appointed rooms.  Internet a bit spotty, but we found that was the case throughout Nigeria on the trip.

Review Title: as always... an oasis of peace in busy Lagos
Review Text: Having visited the hotel on numerous occasions I keep coming back for many reasons. The nice and clean rooms, great showers, good food, excellent service, good location and peaceful atmosphere to relax after a busy day/week in Lagos. To me this hotel is almost like a second home in Lagos.

We spent 5 nights here in May and really enjoyed it. Beautiful rooms and staff were great. If we come back we'd definitely stay here. I would recommend the more expensive rooms as we looked at a few and the more you pay really did equal the quality
Review Text

Review Title: Fine for business, could do better
Review Text: Overall my experience was fine at the Protea, not brilliant but not terrible. Slightly frustrating that at least once per day my key card didn't work in the door, the bathroom wasn't cleaned every day and several times at reception the staff stood chatting ignoring guests, but as a place to sleep for a business trip it was acceptable. Buffet breakfast / lunch was plentiful with a good selection.

The hotel is very good for relaxation and stay for vacation, business visit, private business or meting, The environment is good and conducive, entertaining, luxurious. the rooms are well organized. The food is tasteful.

Review Title: Home away from home in Lagos
Review Text: Its my third visit to the hotel and i can foresee many more future stays. Efficient and friendly check inn, nice rooms, great showers and superb food. All one needs to rejuvenate and recoup before heading back into the daily grind of business in Lagos.  Staff ar very friendly, management have a hands on approach and are very approachable by all their guests. This personalized and friendly welcome and attitude makes it a winner in my books.  Keep it up and i will be back!

Found hotel charming and very clean My guests took me out nightly so I only had breakfast which was tasty and good value Found hotel safe and remember this is Lagos and one needs to dress conservatively and resist from showing jewels or watches Will definitely recommend this hotel and return on next visit

Truly enjoyed my stay, members of staff were helpfuly got us a very lovely apartment ... with a terrible view but this is Lagos you dont get the best of everythig but otherwise we only had to shut our curtains and enjoy our stay. The food is ok but if you can go out and eat out you could get better but otherwise everything else is perfect there... nice gym though its very small its reasonable.   When you are driving to the close were the hotel is located you would wonder what on earth... but once you get into the gate you feel very safe and secure. Worth it if you want a private stay and dont want too much and everyone in your business.

Stayed twice at Protea VI end of February and beginning of March, we held a conference using the conference facility. We were very impressed the hotel was great and the conference was run professionally and we were very happy with the very good conference facility and service and the overall hotel.  The breakfasts were great & the kitchen was great. The dinners we ate at the hotel were excellent.

It was the first time I stayed at the Protea Hotel on Victoria Island during my trip to lagos last month. After a perfect welcome, seamless check in I was whisked to my room. Nice, spacious and with all the functionables on needs during a business trip. Good WiFi, hot shower, great food service (a special thanks to the executive chef, who personally checks on all the guests during morning breakfast serving). In all I had a wonderfull stay (even extended for an additional 2 days instead of moving to another hotel further in Lagos). I will be back!

I stayed 3 nights here on my first trip to Lagos. Safe and secure with plenty of security to make first time travelers to Nigeria feel really safe and welcome. Centrally situated to my business destinations and main city businesses. Staff are friendly, especially reception - waiters on the quiet side but still pleasant and helpful. Wi-fi free for guests and worked immediately with no hassles during my stay. Rooms are well equipped for business needs. Clean, with great shower and bath. Aircon is a must here, so was pleasant to find a really cool room and Aircon worked well throughout stay. Even with power outages, hotel would kick back on immediately - I'm assuming generator. Breakfast was a little on the light side with a limited offer on cereals and yogurts, but had a full

stayed here last week, Charmaine and her team, including Chigozie, Friday and the others go out of their way to make you feel welcome. lovely hotel with good food. twas my second stay here and will definately be coming back. keep up the good work guys.

A very friendly staff and a comfortable room.   However some lack of communication between the folks in the resturant and bar. We ordered our evening meal from the bar and made three requests when our meal would be ready. We then discovered by chance it was on a table in the Resturant all the time! By this time it was stone cold! We had to reorder!  The room was ok but one curtain was hanging off the rails. Are the rooms ever checked?
Review Text

We stayed at the Protea in Victoria Island and where very happy with the great service and great food supplied by Eleanor and Charmaine both of whom where highly visible and very interactive with the guest.  The stay was very relaxing and at a very reasonable price not to mention the very friendly staff members  Thank you for a great stay  Raymond

Very nice rooms, great staff and not bad food! The hotel was quiet (maybe a little too quiet when confined to our hotel). I am going to be coming to Lagos again soon and i will definitely stay here again

Review Title: A little island of calm on VI
Review Text: I have been travelling to Lagos for the past 30 years on business and usually stayed at one of the main international hotels; this was my first stay at the Protea VI.   Anyone reading the TA reviews can get the message; this place has great service, it has clean, comfortable and stylish rooms, the food is excellent, everything works and it is very secure.   In fact, it is a little island of calm!   OK if you want glitz and action then it is not the place for you. The only disadvantage for my work is that there is limited space for meetings; just the (small) bar area and restaurant, because this place has no lobby in the traditional sense.   But, it will certainly be my base of choice in the future on VI as I really liked this place.

Review Title: Too small and quiet, and charged me twice!
Review Text: This is a small hotel on Victoria Island, but its adequate. Reception was very friendly and I was given a bottle of Guinness during check in (although I think that this was just because I‚Äôm Irish!). My room was nice enough, the bed was comfy and the bathroom adequately clean. The hotel was very quiet during my stay. At breakfast there was only a couple of other people apart from my colleague and I. Breakfast is only ok, not a great selection and all of the cereals seemed to be stale. The small bar had a very friendly barman, who was happy to recommend a cocktail for us using some Nigerian juices. The outdoor pool is small, but it‚Äôs partially shaded which is good. The gym is very small, and not air conditioned enough.  A few days after checking out, I noticed that the hotel had

Review Title: One of the best places to stay in Lagos
Review Text: If you are South African, you will feel right at home. The room was spacious, and bathroom very clean. Security is really good - gives you a good sense of comfort knowing that you are safe. The service is really excellent!! Clifford, thank you for the awesome cocktail and your wonderful sense of humour!! The food is good - don't leave without trying their Thai Green chicken curry!! I would say this hotel is better than the Federal Palace which is way more expensive.

My room was very spacious and comfortable. Staff friendly and very professional. I felt secure which was important as this was my first trip to lagos.  The meals were good. A really nice touch was the 'work space' in my room  (a very comfortable desk and chair where i could get some work done in the evenings). Free wi fi is always a plus. Definitely a pleasant stay.

Review Title: Wonderful, exceptional, small Lagos (Victoria Island) hotel!
Review Text: Protea Hotel Victoria Island ‚Äì Lagos, Nigeria  I loved this compact, boutique-style hotel and hope to stay there again the next time I return to Lagos.  The d√©cor is modern but inviting, the staff is friendly and helpful, the room is comfortable, the restaurant was surprisingly excellent, and everything worked including (importantly) the high speed wireless internet.  This hotel ‚Äì Protea Hotel Victoria Island - is located on Victoria Island.  (There is another Protea brand hotel on Victoria Island that has a slightly different full name.  I visited there and it seemed quite nice ‚Äì with a compelling view over a river ‚Äì but I did not stay there.)  The lobby and common areas are modern and somewhat minimalistic but very tasteful.  I had a couple informal meetings in an area just

Review Title: small hotel with a friendly atmosphere
Review Text: I found it small for a business type hotel but that is probably what gave it such a friendly atmosphere. I had to travel to work outside Lagos and it was always a pleasure and relief to return to the Protea in the evenings. Anyone who has worked in Nigeria will know what I mean. My room was clean and comfortable. The internet was reliable and the restaurant was quite good. I felt safe staying there. I don't think there is much more I could ask from a hotel in Nigeria.

I stayed at the Protea VI in October 12, and whilst the staff were all very friendly and helpful the quality of the rooms was way below the star rating. Security of the rooms was poor with balcony doors that would not lock and no way of securing your privacy through the main bedroom door if a master key was used. The 'safe' was not secured in any way, so there was no point in using it. Standard of cleanliness in the bathroom was below average and the water pressure was appalling. The restaurant was tidy and comfortable, but the range of food offered was poor at all meal times. On a Sunday, when I know Lagos folk like to go out to eat, our small party were the only people in the restaurant and the food on offer looked the same as the night before. I travel around the world, on

I stayed at the Protea Hotel Victoria Island for two nights during a business trip to Lagos. I found all staff at the hotel to be exceptionally helpful. My room was large, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was quite nice, with a separate bathtub and shower. The bathroom was far better than many bathrooms I have encountered in hotels in Lagos and Abuja. I would certainly stay here on future visits to Lagos.
Review Text

It was during the occasion of Otunba (Dr) Mike Adenuga Jnr's daughter's wedding reception at Landmark,Oniru Village,Off Ligali Ayorinde Crescent that I lodged there with my then boss. Upon arrival there after my boss my first checked in,I was met by warm Staff by the reception door and my luggage was fetched and kept in a safe place for me since I had to wait for my boss for payment procedures and all that. The Staff are generally accommodating and quire warm. Nice hotels interior and ambiance and clean rooms with particular attention to detail (state of bathroom,closets and balcony area),refreshing inner lounge with a wide array of both traditional and continental cuisines. Prompt room services and customer care quality as well. I will recommend this hotel any day. Thank you.

Review Title: What a pleasant hotel away from home
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel for the past 4 days and what a pleasant place. the rooms are exquisite. the stuff is friendly and very helpful. the restaurant is nice and the food also well prepared. the hotel is very clean, modern and well run. Being a South African from JHB I battled with the heat and humidity and I found the hotel to be the best part of my trip. Chiqozie and Friday were very pleasant and went out of their way to be accommodating to me and my colleague. I would go back to this hotel any day without hesitation.

I spent 10 days at this Hotel; Staff is very friendly and nice, but sometimes they are over friendly specially the young ones who are keen to prove themselves. Room are fine, breakfast is ok nothing exceptional but also you can‚Äôt say that you are missing something. It is a nice place if you are in a business trip you will find all you need but nothing more.

Back again to Protea Hotel VI and upgraded to bigger room by the GM. As always the hotel tries to be good, the room cleaning is very good, the general staff performance is as always good. The restaurant staff are a little off-course and need a little more training to be seen as 'international' or 'business' hotel standard.  The hotel is well managed by the GM and the front office are as helpful as they can be, their manger is a true example of quality guest services management. Thank you Chigozie!  My only negative at this hotel is about the restaurant. A good restaurant is necessary for hotel stays in Lagos, basically due to the difficulty moving around town. The hotel restaurant is let down by a very poor supply chain management method. Often there is a lack of popular drinks,

Review Title: Good Hotel, not really value for money though...
Review Text: Good comfortable hotel, very personable staff, excellent food, comfortable bed, very very good showers. That said, at close to 350$ a night, it is very pricey, given that its at best a 4-star hotel...

Review Title: Perfect Small Hotel for a long Business Trip
Review Text: I stayed at the Pretoria for two weeks. The rooms are nice with hardwood floors, excellent walk in showers and a comfortable bed. This is a very small hotel very quite just what you want when on business. It has a ssmall lounge and restuarant with a decent menu. As with all of Lagos food and drinks are very expensive but with a little shopping through the menu you can still eat reasonably well without spending a fortune. I got breakfast included with my room which I advise doing. The hotel is set off a main road about a block and is difficult to find but security is very good so you do feel at ease while staying there. Taxi's remain parked at the hotel and are readily available anytime. Down side is the parking is all most non existent but you would really need to be nuts to

The hotel is vastly improved compared to 3 years ago.   The rooms and bathrooms are all freshly renovated and offer a fairly decent selection of TV channels.  The restaurant is still not great and I see from another review the "funny smelling burgers" are still on the menu. There are however quite a few decent places to eat and drink near by at budgets to suit all pockets.

Stayed here a night when our other hotel was all full, rooms were nice, quite small but filled with a desk and seating so this made the hotel room quite tight but a fantastic comfy bed! Arrived late at night at the hotel and we ordered food which took about 2hours to arrive and was sub standard. Breakfast was slightly better than the food the night before! Can't really complain with the hotel!

let me start by saying that I have stayed at many Protea Hotels in South Africa, and there are very few (if any) that I have enjoyed, however the Protea Hotel VI is a pleasant surprise. Te hotel looks and feels new, and when you enter it does look that way. The rooms are nice and well furnished, and the bathrooms are very clean as well as also being "new". The staff are all friendly and very observant to your needs. We ate in the Hotel almost all the nights I was there, and except for a funny smelling beef burger, the food really was unexpectedly good.  If I was to fault the hotel (And it is not really their fault), was the the power cut out many, many times, and as I was fairly close to the Generator, it was rather noisy, so make a request to be as far away from the generator

Comfortable, clean rooms.  Nice restaurant, with excellent breakfast.  I needed to change room, as the one they put me at first night was near a noisy energy generator - couldn't sleep that night. They don't have irons or iron boards - in an attempt to make you spend on laundry services.
Review Text

Hi All I've been in the Protea Hotel Victoria Island several times over the last years. The rooms are nice, quite big and spotlessly clean,the Internet works all the time, the staff is very friendly. One of their ladies went shopping in Lagos with my Cameroonian spouse as she was scared to go into Lagos on her own. Of course the place is expensive, but in most cases some company will pay for it...

I recently organised a workshop for 15 people at the Protea Hotel, Victoria Island in Lagos. These things can be a nightmare when there is not enough local support; this was however a very positive experience! Miriam the hostess (apologies if I go the name wrong) is amazing. She was always on hand to assist and just be supportive in general. The rest of the staff were wonderful; I was particularly taken by the fact that when we rather unfairly canceled one room at the last minute, it simply was not an issue. Thanks to the management and staff for making this a very positive experience.

You should always know what to expect from a hotel in Lagos. Overall a decent property; expensive as always but that‚Äôs Nigeria for you. Very good internet connectivity and that‚Äôs a real surprise in Lagos. Hotel has a small Gym but be careful on the Treadmill though as it stops completely in case of power failure. A good bar at the lobby level though very limited choice on the food menu. Staff is exceptional and will always try and help you within their boundaries and skill sets. Rooms are OK and nothing great to be described in them but one should try taking a room on a higher floor as generators are usually on for 20 hours in a day at Lagos.

Really enjoyable, management and staff always willing to go the 'extra mile' to ensure good quality of stay, by ensuring everything is right. That is difficult at the best of times in Lagos and the guys at this hotel manage it. The Avalon Restaurant at the hotel is a joy, my eating place, my work space and meeting zone all in one. I always think it as odd, in the best way, every meal an experience, and generally good quality. There is a special mention of the staff, the very interesting restaurant staff, the super managers, especially Mr. Chigozi and of course GM Charmayne, who will do all she can to facilitate any requests. All-in-all a great place to stay in VI when on business, it will be my base for future visits.

Review Title: Great place to stay in a place with few good hotel choices
Review Text: I have stayed at the Protea Hotel VI on 3 occasions now and each time it has been better. Often my expectations are high and this hotel has met everyone one of those expectations. The decor and cleanliness is good, the room I had was very comfortable. Good wifi throughout, with no drop-out moving from place to place (a good job done by the GM and IT guy). The hotel GM - Charmayne is very receptive to comments and manages the place with a firm and sensible hand and gets close to the hotel services, a pleasant change to see a GM do this. The Executive Chef - James has made the Avalon restaurant a real pleasure to eat in, if the menu isn't my need then Chef James soon fixes-up a good feed, thanks!! A comment on the staff in general, they are willing and headed in the right

Review Title: its hot nd nice also the staffs are very friendly nd the price is worth it.
Review Text: a wonderfull experience i had there the waiters nd staffs wer e very nice nd friendly.the hotel is located at a nice place with a wonderfull view. its really hot......

I stayed at Protea VI from the 17th to the 21st of December with family and friends on the occasion of my best friend's wedding. The whole experience was great! The waiters and all the hotel staff is so nice, friendly and eager to please.  Breakfast was nice and we always had a particular waiter entertaining us about life in Nigeria and getting a smile out the "not- a morning- persons". The rooms are quite clean and we got clean towels every time we asked for them. I started reading a one of the hotel Novels by John Grisham and they agreed to lend it to me to take to Abidjan so I could finish it and my friend's sister in law would bring it back to them. For clubbers, there is the Rehab club/lounge quite nearby. It's a cool lounge with good music and quite a change from the very
It is a nice hotel operated by a very friendly staff.

Review Title: The General Manager has done a great job turning this place around lets hope he stays
Review Text: Over all standards have improved, menu a bit tied , rooms very clean, The General Manager Mr.Pinder has been there only 3 months, lets hope he stays

Review Title: Nice place but can do with better drive way and entrance
Review Text: This is an example of a very good hotel once you're in, but the approach road and even it's driveway to the lobby is really ugly. The room, service, food and even facilities in the hotel like Broadband and gym & pool, etc. are really nice. The bathrooms can do with more user friendly fittings like pegs near the shower, and a retractable cloths line (like at their Victoria Junction, Cape Town)
Review Text

I can't imagine that any hotel in Lagos will be luxurious by western standards, but the Protea Kuramo Waters does a decent job all things considered.  The rooms are kept lean and bed linens are laundered daily.  Furnishings are relatively modern.  The Internet and TV were fairly reliable, but keep in mind that as with any hotels in VI, these services are fed from satellite rather than cable, so are subject to weather interference.  The bar and restaurant, while somewhat limited in selection, had some good items and some not so good.  The chicken and jollof rice was tasty and the minestrone soup was excellent, however the chicken wings were scrawny and tasteless and the steak sandwich was a bit light on the steak.  It kind of depends on what you get.  The pool is clean and

Review Title: Overpriced, lacks good management - can do much better though
Review Text: I've stayed in several hotels in Lagos, and in this one a few times.  I have to admit that the service in this hotel is just a tad bit better than others, but they could do much better. For instance, the room I stayed in had complementary tea & coffee sachets, but the kettle was rusted (see picture).  Breakfast needs improvement also.   This would be a sub-$100 hotel anywhere else on earth but since its Lagos, the price per room is around $400.

I have stayed at this hotel a few times already.  I agree with much of what everyone says: very expensive hotel and not that great in return.  Rooms are substandard, water pressure is weak and senior management needs training.  A very good location and VI is the posh part of town so its no wonder protea charges what it does.  Power outages are common and takes staff a while to put the generator on; email is slow.  Food is mediocre at best.  Housekeeping and the guys at reception are great!

I agree with all that is in Zinsky's Summary above....ok hotel, but nothing special given the price. The hotel was clean and surrounding guarded courtyard/parking area seemed safe enough. Nice enough bar and small pool area. That said smallish room with twin-sized bed, AC that never quite cooled the room below sweat point, front desk with an attitude, service in restaurant slow despite a lot of staff milling aimlessly about, buffet in restaurant (at $60) really the only choice of food besides lunch menu, internet access never available during my 2 week stay (except by phone at 20 a min), and no place to exercise...all disappoint for a $300/night hotel. Lord help you if you do not happen to carry a visa card‚Ä¶as any other method of payment is out of the question....despite, as

I spent four days at this hotel in Nov. 2007 over a weekend and week days. Admittedly being here over the weekend must be factored in because I was quite bored yet it also gave me plenty of time to come to know the property's virtues and lack thereof. First my opinion was colored by the fact that the rooms are over $300 a night; it is simply way too overpriced, it in no way belongs in the category to charge this much. I am American but travel all over the world and have quite a bit of experience in different African countries, so I'm not holding my punches out of any sense of pc, etc. Also I just came from Senegal where the experience was great for two thirds the price. But for this price you get a barely adequate room, although clean. The bathroom is technically clean but again

I stayed at the Protea in Apirl during the last elections.  The hotel was clean and the facilities were fine.  I had a problem with my water which was resolved quickly.  There was a problem with my safe which was not resolved for several hours which led to me flying internally without a passport.  The staff were helpful and curteous.

Stayed in this hotel on a recent visit to lagos, i was quite impressed having heared all sorts of horror stories about the city. Upon arriving at the hotel, i was greated by a surprisingly well mannered staff, i was treated well and i felt a sort of tranquility not felt anywhere in the city. Maybe it was because i could see a couple of military men patrolling the surroundings. I definitely will recommend it to any safety conscious individuals visiting lagos.    Ahmed, London

It was nice to find such a nice hotel in Lagos by our business partners. The staff is well educated and very friendly and helpful, the rooms are modern and clean. The restaurant offers nice local and international food. To say it in one sentence: This hotel is a very good choice to enjoy Victoria Island.

My husband and I spent 3 nights at Protea right after our wedding reception. I was very impressed with the courteous staff, nice pool and very cozy atmosphere. The actual room was a bit small  however the living section made up for the space. The staff was very poliet and attended to all our needs. We truly enjoyed our stay prior to returning to the states. I will definately return. The only draw back is that is was a bit pricy but I guess we were paying for the comfort, safety and amibance.

Nice hotel, nice location. A little bit small and, in my opinion, about 25% overpriced. But all in all very comfortable. It has an advantage over the bigger hotels, which seem to have a problem with maintenance, and tend to go through periods of delapidation. The new set of smaller hotels, some privately owned, seems to be the way forward in terms of comfort security and location.   SC
Review Text

It is a good hotel for the business traveller. It has a small dining area, average food,  small pool and  friendly staff. It is smallish for a hotel but you have all you need for your business needs, besides it is at the heart of Victoria Island. And as it is small, the staff can control the scammers who actaully prey on the visitors on other bigger business hotels on the island. The only negative is, it can be noisy if the generator is running ( and it does 1/3 of the time)...
